content.description: Sit start on the south side of the boulder with a positive right hand on a sloper and a left hand on a small crimp. From there move a) a left hand move to a bump or b) move straight to the lip. The feet are the real crux as they are few and far between, particularly at the beginning.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. The landing is okay, but there is a rock behind, so the landing zone could be in question.
content.location: This is located on the south side of the boulder. There are multiple ways to down climb the boulder.

climbs.name: A Stumbling Bag of Bones and Skin

content.description: Sit start in the middle arete of the south face. Make a big move up, and use positive holds to top out.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. The landing isn't great, but a spotter helps a lot.
content.location: This is located on the south-central face of the boulder. There are several downclimbs once you're topped out.
